solution_line_template: Michael sold {num_large_birdhouses_sold} large birdhouses for ${price_large_birdhouse} each, so he made {num_large_birdhouses_sold}*${price_large_birdhouse}= $<<{num_large_birdhouses_sold}*{price_large_birdhouse}={large_birdhouse_sales}>>{large_birdhouse_sales} from large birdhouse sales.

Michael also sold {num_medium_birdhouses_sold} medium birdhouses for ${price_medium_birdhouse} each, so he made {num_medium_birdhouses_sold}*${price_medium_birdhouse}= $<<{num_medium_birdhouses_sold}*{price_medium_birdhouse}={medium_birdhouse_sales}>>{medium_birdhouse_sales} from medium birdhouse sales.

Michael sold {num_small_birdhouses_sold} small birdhouses for ${price_small_birdhouse} each, so he made {num_small_birdhouses_sold}*{price_small_birdhouse}=$<<{num_small_birdhouses_sold}*{price_small_birdhouse}={small_birdhouse_sales}>>{small_birdhouse_sales} from small birdhouse sales.

Since Michael made ${large_birdhouse_sales} from large birdhouse sales, ${medium_birdhouse_sales} from medium birdhouse sales, and ${small_birdhouse_sales} for small birdhouse sales, he made ${large_birdhouse_sales}+${medium_birdhouse_sales}+${small_birdhouse_sales}= $<<{large_birdhouse_sales}+{medium_birdhouse_sales}+{small_birdhouse_sales}={total_money_made}>>{total_money_made} total this week.
